name: Haystack Software
headline: Visualize and edit your codebase on an infinite canvas
description:
Haystack is a a canvas-based IDE that automates the tedious and mechanical steps of software development -- plumbing, refactoring, and finding code -- so that software engineers can focus on the important parts. 

In Haystack, users can explore and edit their code on a 2D canvas with a navigational copilot assisting every step of their way.

founders.name: Jake Yatvitskiy, Founder
founders.description: Cofounder of Haystack Software. Experienced with AI and Cloud technologies. Previously worked in the High-Performance Computing division at AWS and received a Master's Degree in Machine Learning from Columbia University

founders.name: Akshay Subramaniam, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder of Haystack Software. Enjoys building emulators, video games, and productivity software. 

Previously was a software engineer at Figma, where I led the multi-edit launch and helped launch Find and Replace, accessibility in FigJam, and more!

generated_description:
### Haystack Software: Simplifying Code Development

Haystack Software is a promising startup founded in 2024, right in the buzzing tech hub of San Francisco. The company is part of Y Combinator's Batch S24, which speaks volumes about its potential and the innovative approach it's taking in the software development landscape.

**Mission**  
The core mission of Haystack Software is clear and ambitious: to help software engineers visualize and edit their codebase on an infinite canvas. This is not just a lofty vision; it's about prioritizing creativity and efficiency over the tedious mechanics that often bog developers down.

**What They Do**  
At its heart, Haystack is a canvas-based Integrated Development Environment (IDE) designed to automate those repetitive and mind-numbing tasks of programming—think plumbing, refactoring, and code searching. With Haystack, developers can focus on what really matters: building great software. Users can navigate a 2D canvas effortlessly, with a friendly navigational copilot guiding them through the editing and exploration of their code. 

**Features**  
The platform allows you to easily refactor your code, make function or method calls, and even save and load workspaces, which makes transitioning in and out of work seamless. The intuitive design and features promise to transform how developers interact with their projects.

**Team and Support**  
Haystack is a lean operation, currently made up of a team of two. With David Lieb as their group partner, they show that small teams can still dream big. They also encourage community involvement through avenues such as GitHub for contributions and Discord for discussion.

**Explore More**  
For those intrigued by the potential of this revolutionary tool, you can dive deeper into Haystack Software through their website [here](https://haystackeditor.com). They also have resources available like a code reviewer and a changelog, which can help users stay updated with the latest changes and features.

**Conclusion**  
In summary, Haystack Software is tuned in to the needs of modern software developers, marrying technology with design in a way that increases productivity and fosters creativity. It's a promising venture for anyone looking to enhance their coding experience. If you're a developer, this might just be the tool you've been waiting for—where coding meets visual creativity on an infinite canvas.
